page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN THE KIRKBY AREA
page.content: Transport facilities in the Kirkby area are poor.There was once a{railway line with a station near Cowan Bridge but it closed to passenger traffic many years ago and is now completely disused.There are only two regular{bus {services}each day;one goes between Sedbergh and Kendal;and the other to Lancaster,each catering for the school children.In summer a coach comes from the Morecambe area on market days.A car is essential as a means of transport and this intensifies traffic problems.A{by-pass}was built to the town in the 1920s.Many of the surrounding{roads and lanes}are narrow ,only suitable for one vehicle and in summer virtually overgrown.A few people ride{horses}for pleasure but none are used on the farms for agricultural purposes.
